speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe when you first noticed the vomiting started?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started right after birth, actually. The mother said it was within the first few hours, I'm not really sure. She said it's been a constant issue ever since."

speaker: Doctor
text: Did the vomiting start immediately after birth or did it begin a few hours later? REQUEST TEST: Abdominal ultrasound.

speaker: Doctor
text: Was the baby able to pass meconium within the first 24 hours after birth? REQUEST TEST: Abdominal ultrasound.

speaker: Doctor
text: The baby was not able to pass meconium within the first 24 hours, and the vomiting seems to have started about 12 hours post-birth. REQUEST TEST: Abdominal ultrasound.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Abdominal Ultrasound: No free fluid in the abdomen, but the bowel appears to be dilated and tortuous, with a transition zone at the rectosigmoid region.

speaker: Doctor
text: Is the baby showing any signs of discomfort or pain during the vomiting? DIAGNOSIS READY: Hirschsprung's disease.
